title: Ballaban Badera
content: Ballaban Badera (also known as Ballaban Pasha or Ballaban Badheri)[1] was an Ottoman military officer from Albania. A conscript of the Devshirme child soldier system, he became a Pasha. Ballaban Badera was said to be the first one who climbed the walls of Constantinople during its siege.[2] He held the position of sanjakbey of the Sanjak of Ohrid in 1464 and 1465.[3][4]
